department.ch: 客家語文暨社會科學學系
department.en: Department of Hakka Language and Social Sciences

goal.ch: 本課程「客家文學選」个課程目標，目的在於分學員認識臺灣當代客家文學个作家同作品，形式包括民間文學、小說、散文同詩歌个部份，透過這課程希望做得分學生讀到當代台灣客家文學个作品同作家，學習仰般解讀、詮釋作品个方法同角度，同時習得用客語創作文學个觀念同方法。
goal.en: The goal of this course “Selected Readings of Hakka Literature“ is to let students know the writers and works of contemporary Taiwanese Hakka literature. The form includes folk literature, novels, prose and poetry. Through this course, it is hoped that students can read contemporary Taiwanese Hakka literature. Works and writers, learn how to interpret and interpret the methods and angles of works, and at the same time learn the concepts and methods of creating literature in Hakka.

outline.ch:
1.客家民間文學選讀
2.客家文學小說選讀
3.客家文學散文選讀
4.客家文學詩歌選讀
5.客家文學詮釋與評論
outline.en:
1. Selected Readings of Hakka Folk Literature
2. Selected readings of Hakka literary novels
3. Selected readings of Hakka literary prose
4. Selected readings of Hakka literature and poetry
5. Interpretation and commentary on Hakka literature

5.李喬主編（2004）《台灣客家文學選集Ⅱ》。台北市。前衛出版社。

7.黃子堯主編（2016）《客語文學散文選》。新北市。台灣客家筆會。
8.黃子堯主編（2016）《客語文學小說選》。新北市。台灣客家筆會。
textbook.en:
1. Qiu Yifan, 2012 “Ethnic Group. language. Literature: A Collection of Hakka Poetry Literature. Miaoli. Laurel Books Ltd.
2. Qiu Yifan wrote 2017 “A Pile of Fire on the Road - Hakka Poetry“. Miaoli. Laurel Books Ltd.
3. Qiu Yifan wrote 2018 “Long Flowing Water - Hakka Essays“. Miaoli. Laurel Books Ltd.
4. Li Qiao edited (2004) “Taiwan Hakka Literature Anthology I“. Taipei City. Vanguard Press.
5. Li Qiao edited (2004) “Taiwan Hakka Literature Anthology II“. Taipei City. Vanguard Press.
6. Edited by Huang Ziyao (2016) “Anthology of Hakka Literature and Poems“. New Taipei City. Taiwan Hakka Pen Club.
7. “Selected Essays in Hakka Literature“ edited by Huang Ziyao (2016). New Taipei City. Taiwan Hakka Pen Club.
8. Huang Ziyao editor-in-chief (2016) “Selection of Hakka Literary Novels“. New Taipei City. Taiwan Hakka Pen Club.

gradMethod.ch: 上課出席60％、創作發表20％、書面心得或者報告20％。
gradMethod.en: 60％ of class attendance, 20％ of creation and publication, and 20％ of written experience or report.

officeHour.ch: 星期四下午三點到五點

flexDiscription.ch: 16週按照課程進度，兩週做為學生撰寫報告或創作的討論。
flexDiscription.en: 16 weeks according to the progress of the course, two weeks as a discussion for students to write reports or create.
